title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire on Wednesday, 1 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: the future of wellingborough 's castle theatre remains uncertain after an extraordinary meeting of the borough castle of wellingborough last night .
milton keynes dons are moving forward with plans for a new training facility in cosgrove .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: it may have been a damp start to summer , but today we 've been reporting on the efforts to save wellingborough 's castle theatre and delays in treatment for motor neurone disease patients .
but do n't forget the dancing teachers from moulton school and the wootton hall ducklings .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , weather and travel from 08:00 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: art gallery building could be bought by council
text: northampton borough council is set to buy 9 guildhall road which is the home of the nn contemporary art gallery .
next week , the council 's cabinet will decide whether to pay northamptonshire county council £ 462,000 for the building .
conservative councillor tim hadland said they want the building `` used in a way that will complement the cultural quarter '' .
he said the art gallery would continue to occupy the building .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: bishop repeats call for unity over eu vote
text: the church of england 's bishop of peterborough , whose diocese covers northamptonshire , has reiterated his belief the eu referendum is unnecessary .
the rt rev donald allister said : `` we have representative democracy where people are chosen and set apart to make decisions and lead . ''
in a statement issued today , the bishop said he would not tell people how to vote , but added there is a danger of a `` disunited country '' .
a real duty for all of us , but especially politicians , [ is ] to work at staying united as a nation '' .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: teachers show school leavers they 've got all the moves
text: full marks to staff of moulton school who 've made a video for their year 11 pupils
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: travel : one lane closed on m1 southbound
text: one lane is closed and there is queuing traffic on the m1 southbound between j18 and j17 .
the delay , said to be severe , is due to a broken down white van .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather watchers : we might see the sun tomorrow
text: weather watcher 'ziggy 's wood ' has posted this of this afternoon 's heavy clouds -but the forecast is brighter for tomorrow .
the rain and drizzle should clear and by tomorrow afternoon we might even see some sunny spells .
now , where are my shades ?
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: residents angry at rushden homes proposal
text: plans to demolish a house and former garage building in rushden and replace them with nine new homes has angered residents in the town .
outline planning permission is being sought for the land on northampton road .
nine two-bedroom homes would be built .
rushden and higham ferrers town councils have objected claiming it 's `` over-development '' and `` quantity not quality '' .
councillors are due to decide whether to grant outline planning permission at a meeting this evening .
east northamptonshire council 's planning officers are recommending the plans are approved .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: mk dons training ground 'would destroy an area of natural beauty '
text: milton keynes dons are moving forward to get a new training facility built in cosgrove over the northamptonshire border , but not everyone is in favour of the move .
a facebook group and petition have been started by people who want the land to stay as it is .

the 'save the fields at cosgrove ' group believe the scale of the development does `` not belong in the heart of the countryside '' and will `` completely destroy an area of natural beauty and heritage enjoyed by many '' .

documents.title: mk dons fans 'disappointed ' new training ground will be built in northants
text: new plans have been lodged by milton keynes dons for a training facility in cosgrove , with the club set to request planning permission later this year .

tom stewart , from mk dons supporters ' association , said the site is needed to develop `` new talent '' that the club currently needs - but added it is a `` disappointment '' that it wo n't be built in the new city .
but not as disappointed as some northants residents are

documents.title: cute for a dull wednesday
text: we love these photos tweeted by northamptonshire police of ducklings paying a visit to wootton hall .
were they released without charge ?
northants police
northantspolice
just had a mother & her ducklings walk into reception at hq .
hoping the @ twitterid will be able to assist .
just had a mother & her ducklings walk into reception at hq .
hoping the @ twitterid will be able to assist .
she was here a few weeks ago house hunting .
did n't bring the family that day
can you ask them if they have found my van keys yet , they 've been in police hands for a year now .
incompetent half heads
awww they should move out by themselves , but please call @ twitterid on 0300 1234 999 for assistance .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: updated plans for former rushden shoe factory
text: plans to turn rushden 's former grenson shoe factory into flats are due to be discussed this evening .
the turreted , grade ii listed building has been described as one of the best preserved boot and shoe factories in the town .
the four-storey factory on queen street dates from around 1890 and was in use until 2013 .
plans to turn it into 16 flats were approved in 2014 , despite opposition from english heritage and the victorian society .
at a meeting this evening , the developer is applying to change the planning permission so 14 flats can be created .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: travel : severe delays and fuel spillage on a1 at wittering
text: there is queuing traffic and one lane is blocked on the a1 southbound at the wittering turn-off .
it 's because of an accident involving four vehicles and a fuel spillage .
there is severe congestion stretching as far as wothorpe .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: corby 's core to create own christmas show
text: corby 's core at corby cube theatre is to produce its own christmas show this year , for the first time in six years .
charles dickens ' a christmas carol is written and directed by gary sefton , who previously directed the theatre 's first show , hansel and gretel .
in recent years , touring shows have been bought in for the christmas period , rather than produced in-house .
it will run from 8 - 31 december .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: the castle : the drama continues
text: yesterday 's extraordinary meeting about the castle theatre is the latest act in a long-running drama .
we 've already heard from a drama group which says it 's owned £ 14,500 , and from the leader of the council , who says communication with the theatre management had broken down .
all parties are said to be looking for a solution to the castle 's problems , but no one knows how this drama will end .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: man taken to hospital after car hit a verge on the a43
text: a man suffered serious injuries yesterday when he lost control of his car and it came off the road into a verge .
the incident happened on the a43 northbound , near to the entry slip road at the a413 , dadford road junction .
the man , who had been driving a white nissan skyline , was taken by ambulance to john radcliffe hospital .

documents.title: fractured jaw after corby kebab shop attack
text: a 22-year-old man suffered a fractured jaw after he was assaulted outside flames kebab shop in corby .
the incident happened at 02:35 on sunday , but northamptonshire police have only just given details .
the man was punched in the face , knocking him unconscious .
his attacker is described as a white man , in his late 20s , with light coloured hair that was slightly receding at the front .
he was wearing a grey hooded top and blue jeans that were cropped at the knees .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: travel : windmill avenue in kettering closed
text: the a6098 windmill avenue in kettering town centre is closed because of an accident between two vehicles .
traffic is queuing in both directions at the deeble road junction .
delays are said to be severe .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : a grey day for the start of summer
text: the meteorologists say it 's the first day of summer but it does n't feel like it .
weather watcher 'alice.t ' has posted this photo from duddington .
forecasters say it 'll remain cloudy all afternoon , with patchy light rain and drizzle at times .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: northampton man says he wo n't give in to motor neurone disease
text: david solomon , from northampton , was a keen runner before being diagnosed with motor neurone disease .
pictured here with his fiancee paula pinney , david was talking after the northampton-based motor neurone disease association pointed out long delays in diagnosis and treatment of mnd patients .
he says he 'll remain active for as long as possible .
i refuse - i absolutely refuse - to give in to it . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel : a14 partially blocked at thrapston
text: the a14 eastbound is partially blocked near thrapston causing very slow traffic between j12 and j13 .
it 's because of an earlier accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: northampton charity highlights delays in motor neurone disease treatment
text: a fifth of people with motor neurone disease had to wait more than a year to see a specialist after going to their gp .
that 's the headline from a survey by the northampton-based mnd association , which says long delays for diagnoses and treatment of the condition is partly due to the inexperience of gps .
motor neurone disease is a progressive disease that attacks the nerves in the brain and spinal cord .
prof stephen hawking is the best known person with the disease .
on average , a gp will see one case of motor neurone disease in their career so when a person comes into their surgery they wo n't recognise that it 's mnd .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rushden teacher in plea for stem cell match from stranger to help cure rare bone marrow disease
text: the northants telegraph tells the story of tilly tillbrook , 25 , . a teacher at wrenn academy in wellingborough who was diagnosed with bone marrow failure when she was 17 .
she 's now hoping a stranger will come forward with matching bone marrow so she can have a life-saving transplant .

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : council leader claims theatre trustees were n't 'upfront about finances '
text: communication between the borough council of wellingborough and the group running the castle theatre had broken down , according to the authority 's leader .
conservative martin griffiths said it had `` reached a situation whereby they were not entirely upfront with the state of their finances '' .
the council decided to terminate its contract with the castle wellingborough ltd in march .
shortly afterwards the theatre went into administration .

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : the financial implication for amateur dramatics groups
text: we 've already talked about how one of wellingborough 's biggest amateur dramatics groups is owed £ 14,500 by the castle theatre .
but how do the smaller groups in its debt cope ?
jane cox , from the wellingborough co-operative amateur dramatic group , said : `` if we do n't get money from a current production we ca n't afford the next one . ''
she said the current situation could lead to three or four local amateur dramatics groups having to close .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : weeks of work on the line for amateur groups about to play castle
text: members of wellingborough 's co-op amateur dramatic group - due to perform at the castle theatre in two weeks time - say they have n't received any money from the theatre yet .

director jane cox said the group is normally paid after completing a show , adding : `` we were assured when it went into administration that anything since then is protected , but as to money before that , we have no reassurances . ''
we have everything crossed we will be able to present our play .
our actors have been rehearsing for weeks and weeks . ''

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : summer programme of plays should go ahead
text: one amateur dramatics group in wellingborough is really struggling with the `` side effects '' of the town 's theatre entering administration .
the wellingborough co-operative amateur dramatic group is due to put on a comedy of the same name in two weeks time .
director jane cox says they `` very much hope it will happen '' and that the group has been `` assured by administartors that the summer programme is proceeding '' .

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : operatic society has lost £ 14,000 due to theatre administration
text: we 've heard how the future of wellingborough 's castle theatre is uncertain - but what effect does that have on the amateur dramatics groups that perform there .
clive adams , from the wellingborough amateur operatic and dramatic society , said his company lost £ 14,500 when the theatre went into administration .
it 's not quite sunk us , but very nearly .
we are struggling , but have every confidence we will rise , like a phoenix , from the ashes . ''

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : uncertain times for venue opened by jeremy irons
text: built on a former cattle market and opened in 1995 by then patron , jeremy irons - the future for wellingborough 's castle theatre looked bright .
but in march , the borough council of wellingborough decided to terminate the contract of its board of trustees .
the authority accused the castle wellingborough ltd - the charity which runs the venue - of `` poor financial management '' .
now it 's future may rest in the hands of those same councillors , as they mull over a report which could decide its future .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: castle theatre 's future : report will consider 'community involvement ' and 'funding '
text: the future of wellingborough 's castle theatre remains uncertain after an extraordinary meeting of the borough castle of wellingborough last night .
councillors have agreed to compile a report on the authority 's future involvement in the theatre , which is currently in administration .
they pledged to `` consider community involvement '' and `` appropriate funding provisions '' .

documents.title: weather : dull , with grey skies and drizzle
text: it 'll be a damp start for today with mist , drizzle and fog likely .
outbreaks of heavy rain are also possible , mainly during the morning .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
for more on the forecast for where you live , head over to bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live
text: morning folks .
it 's june and the british summer has truly arrived - you can tell by the rain teeming down outside .
the below was taken by one of our weather watchers 'jesscow ' in deanshanger , who managed to find at least one bright spot in the rain .
we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , ( wet ) weather and travel until 18:00 .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News
